Immunoglobulin.1: The study shows that IgM is the first antibody involved in an infection

Immunoglobulin.2: IgM is the largest antibody and it is the first antibody to appear in the initial exposure to an antigen

Immunoglobulin.3: IgM can bind complement component C1 and activate the classical pathway, leading to opsonization of antigens and cytolysis

Immunoglobulin.4: IgG account for approximately 75% of all serum immunoglobulins

Immunoglobulin.5: As for the extracellular pathogens IgG stimulates another kind of immune response called antibody dependent cellular cytotoxicity

Immunoglobulin.6: IgE is thought to be an important part of the immune response against infection caused by bacteria
